definitions.definition: a voucher entitling the holder to a discount for a particular product.
examples: voucher, token, ticket; Moreinformalcomp, rain check "grocery coupons"Morecomp, rain check grocery coupons

definitions.definition: a detachable portion of a bond that is given up in return for a payment of interest.
a form in a newspaper or magazine that may be filled in and sent as an application for a purchase or information.
examples: form, tear-off card fill in the coupon below

definitions.definition: (of a business) issue or distribute coupons or vouchers offering discounts on particular goods or services.
examples: the company announced plans to reduce its couponing and just cut prices instead

definitions.definition: (of a consumer) collect and use coupons or vouchers offering discounts on goods or services.
examples: couponing has dropped their monthly grocery budget by upwards of $1,100 per month
